Calvin Harris

Tonight felt more like a party than a gig, with various pre-Halloween get ups dotted around the venue, my personal favourite being the barman in a banana costume.

Michael Craig-Martin

<strong>Emma Rudec</strong>k interviews the creator of An Oak Tree, the seminal Michael Craig-Martin.

Antonia Shaw

A year ago, I nervously stood up in front of a room full of students. I promised them I would overhaul the arts pages of Nouse, shifting the focus of coverage from our campus bubble to national culture. For better or for worse my pledge paid off and I was elected Arts Editor

Fever Chart

In the intimate setting of the York Theatre Royal, playwright Naomi Wallace's Fever Chart brings to life heartfelt stories based on real-life events through intelligent, poetic prose.

Death and the Maiden

Death and the Maiden centres around the life of Paulina, a Latin American woman who, turned mad by an incident involving rape and torture 15 years ago, believes she has discovered the identity of her unknown captor upon hearing the Schubert's 'Death and the Maiden'.

Richard Prince

<strong>Beki Senior</strong> asks why the 'Father of Appropriation' had work removed from the Tate.

Pop Life at the Tate Modern

<strong>Lowenna Valerie Waters</strong> discusses Tate Modern's Pop Life: Art in a Material World exhibition and considers whether Pop Art is relevant to contemporary art .

Script Factor

Script Factor is a forum for local scriptwriters to present short plays to an intimate audience in The Studio at the York Theatre Royal

Graphic: The Process of Print Review

The Norman Rea Gallery kick-started their new year's programme of events this week with the opening of Graphic: The process of print.

Rupert Brooke

First performed last year, Mark Payton's play about one of the most celebrated War poets returned to the York Theatre Royal this weekend on Remembrance Sunday, three days before the ninetieth anniversary of the armistice.

Annie

This Tony award-winning musical is a favourite amongst children, pets, parents, grandparents, and the whole motley crew.

Reflections on War

This small exhibition captures this contemporary spirit through powerful and personal pieces of true art. (Thumbnail credit Sydney Carline, The Trails of War, 1919 (Purchased by the Museums &amp; Galleries Commission and Friends of York Art)

Half Moon Man

The Half-Moon Man, written and directed by Max Tyler, is an entertaining and thought provoking example of student theatre.

Mayerling

Traditionally, one expects very little in variation of theme when attending the ballet

The Bald Prima Donna

As student performances go, the standard of acting at the Drama Barn is always high, and this week's piece, Eugene Ionesco's nonsensical Bald Prima Donna, is no exception.

The plight of the Invisible Children

James Cousins explores the world of Uganda's hidden child soliders and examines the growing toll of Africa's longest running civil war.

Wine

I stare blankly at the bottle on the table. I fight hard to control the nausea washing over me like a tsunami. This, however, is no natural disaster; someone made a choice to buy this product.

Goji Vegetarian Cafe and Deli

Inside Goji is small and quirky, with entertaining views of another, much better looking cafe, a sex shop, and an assortment of charity shops and old people to keep you occupied.

Duncan Pelham

Does Danny Boyle have a tendency to glamourise squalor and degradation?

The Hurt Locker

Kathryn Bigelow's last film, K-19: The Widowmaker, was concerned, like her newest effort, with military conflict

Up

A grumpy 78 year old man isn't the obvious choice for a Pixar movie hero

If....

"It's a natural characteristic of adolescents to want to proclaim individuality... It's a quite blameless form of existentialism".

York's music and clubbing scene

Once you've unpacked, done your hair, met your flatmates and checked your timetable, the more musically minded freshers among you will probably want to investigate York's noble music scene.

Laura Hulley

As we all climb out the gentle coma that the fuzzy summer months brought, the last memories of long, light nights and slow, grinding hangovers are still memorable - just.

Leeds Piano Competition '09

The tribulations of Leeds Pianoforte Competition are <strong>Peter Campbell'</strong>s subject of choice.

Nouse Playlist

<strong>Laura Hulley</strong> <em>Jay Z ft. Alicia Keys</em> <strong>Isaac Hewlings</strong><em>Wolfgang Gartner</em> <strong>Estella Adeyeri</strong> <em>Chromeo</em>

Melt!

The Melt electro night has been around since the beginning of last term, yet it seems to be steadily growing in stature and blending into the environment of York's small underground electronic music scene.

Dream Theater

The American progressive metal band, comprising of five members of virtuosic ability, have had an epic history.

Polly Morgan

One might be forgiven for presuming a topic like taxidermy to be more familiar to a demographic of middle aged men.

Antonia Shaw

Whitewashed shop windows, dilapidated signage and decaying frontages are a testament to and constant reminder of the economic turmoil we are currently living in.
